label: 天狗
本: The Seven Tengu Scrolls: Evil and the Rhetoric of Legitimacy in Medieval Japanese Buddhism . University of Hawai'i Press . 2012
説明文: celestial dog." The tengu popularly known in Japan today have beaks or long noses, wings, and human bodies, and are often disguised as yamabushi (mountain ascetics). Yamabushi themselves worship tengu as guardians of the mountains, where much of the mountain ascetics' religious training takes place. "
